page.title: 13Changing Times in E/Calder
page.content: In 1945 East Calder was very different from what it is now. The only houses were along the Main Street and part of Langton Road.Since then hundreds of new houses have been built-Mansefield,Bellway and Wimpey. In 1945 most people worked in shale mines and oilworks in the area especially Pumpherston.Now people who work up to 20-30 miles away live here. In 1945 there were a lot more shops than there are now.Nowadays most women prefer to drive to supermarkets in Livingston to do their shopping. One thing that hasn't changed is that people still go to Edinburgh for their entertainment.People go to the cinema, theatre,indoor bowling and swimming. In 1945 the only entertainment in East Calder was 2 bowling greens and the cinema in the scout hall. by Sharon,Leanne and Amy.
